title: Can't do more than one search on Metacritic; probably bad cookie
content:
Starting this week, I can do only one search for a movie title on Metacritic.com. I get a 403 error from any attempt to do a subsequent search. I can get one more successful search if I first delete my Metacritic cookies from Firefox. But the problem repeats after any successful search.

Repeated searches work fine if I access Metacritic via Chrome. In case it matters, I'm running both browsers under Windows 10 on a desktop.

Can I tell Firefox not to accept cookies from Metacritic? Other ideas?
creator: lyle.ramshaw

title: Locked out of banking website
content: For several days, I've been locked out of a banking website I use regularly (Fidelity) using Firefox on two different computers. However, I can access the site using Safari. I'm using an iMac 24 and a Macbook Pro. I've cleared the cache, have turned off the ad blocker for the site, and have an up to date version of Firefox. Thanks in advance for help.

title: Messenger (Facebook) I can't see the other person, just a black screen
content: I'm on the latest version of Firefox 109.0.1 and Facebook messenger on video calls now won't display the screen of the other person (whether I call them or they call me makes no difference). Works fine on MS-Edge (and probably others but I haven't tried). I looked up the problem and it seems like others have it or something similar, but it says Problem archived, post another question if you need help. Happy to collect diagnostics if it helps solve the problem; I don't want to start having to use a different browser because I like Firefox.
creator: jhturner108

title: Default email fix
content: On my computer, Firefox keep loading my wife's email by default. I checked that my email is still listed as the primary email in my Firefox account. And I can log into my email. But every time I restart Firefox, it loads my wife's email, even when I click on my email bookmark. How do I fix this?

title: Where are my Bookmarks and extension files now? I CRY :(( I was so stupid....Had two times firefox installation on my Mac
content:
Hello,

I am so stupid. I had a brand new Mac in November, and sadly accidentially installed firefox twice withouth knowing.

(once installed in Programms once installed on my Desktop, because I was not used to the Mac Installation method with dragging simply the file and not to choose installation directory)

Today I wanted to clean my desktop a little so i moved every icon to wherever it needed to be. I moved also firefox to - Programms on mac and it asked me if i want to keep both - i clicked yes.

Sadly now I have FireFox and Firefox Copy in my Programmfiles but my Firefox bookmakrs and everything is missing now (Because, it was safed on the "firefox" that was "installed" on my Desktop. thats a big nightmare, because i make everyday bookmarks for my work and everything, now the firefox that is installed on the programms is not containing anything, every bookmark, every stored session (from tab session manager addon) is gone....

How can I get these bookmarks back? I dont have normaly overwritten something, I just need to know, how can I access these Bookmark files again? Why even are these things missing now, I just moved firefox Icon to the programm folders from my desktop...

I had the "firefox Account sync activated" now i logged in intoe the empty firefox but nothing has changed no bookmarks, no addon files I could cry for real so much work lost thats a nightmare...

If someone could help I sent money instantly...
creator: schmitt.felix.7

title: How to disable or configure 3 fingers tap behavior
content:
Hi, I'm running Firefox 109 on Win11 on a recent lenovo laptop with touchpad gesture and I can't find the way to disable a 3 fingers tap behavior specific to firefox.

I want 3 fingers tap to only open link in a new tab (mouse middle click) witch is working fine and match win11 touchpad gesture setting.

But in firefox, when I'm not exactly on a link, the 3 fingers tap is giving me a round with 2 vertical narrows and a dot (see screenshot below), and then any touch on the touchpad is scrolling the page, really fast if swiping vertically, or slowly if swiping horizontally.

I can't find any about:config parameter about this behavior. I found a lot of discussion about 3 finger swipe on Mac computer but nothing specific to three finger tap and scroll (Like Here or Here)

If someone has any clue, or just the name of this function that I could look for it, I can't translate it right to find anything. Thanks a lot
creator: Sablotin

title: App Crashing on My Chromebook
content:
Hello everyone,

I hope this message finds you well. I am having an issue with Mozilla Firefox on my Chromebook. Lately, I have noticed that the browser has been crashing frequently and taking a long time to load pages. I have tried clearing the cache and cookies, but that hasn't seemed to help.

Has anyone else experienced this issue with Firefox on a Chromebook? If so, what steps did you take to resolve the problem? Any suggestions or advice would be greatly appreciated.

Details of my setup: Chromebook Laptop - IdeaPad Flex 3i Chromebook (15” Intel) Operating system: Chrome OS Mozilla Firefox version: Firefox, v109. 0.1

Thank you in advance for your help.

Best regards, Judy
creator: judywatsonn

creator: lukaszmac

title: Unable to launch Firefox profile from "/" directory in Ubuntu22
content:
OS - Ubuntu22 Firefox - Default firefox on ubuntu22 (Mozilla Firefox 103.0.1)

Use case - 1. Custom profile folder (named prof1) contains pref.js and chrome folder with custom css file. 2. prof1 is created in -> "/customData/profiles/prof1" 3. The folder "/customData" has full rwx permissions and is owned by $USER (not by root)

Output -> 1. When launching firefox mentioning the profile -> "$ firefox --profile /customData/profiles/prof1"

The browser does not load, but there is an error box saying Profile Missing Your Firefox profile cannot be loaded. It may be missing or inaccessible.


Questions -> 1. Is it possible to load firefox profile from root directory ? 2. If custom profile folder is created in "/home", then it is launching and working perfectly. How is this possible when the permissions and owner is same as the one in "/customData"
creator: sagnik.sourendrapal

title: I need help.
content:
Hello, I am contacting you guys in hopes of a fix of the removing the following certificate not going away despite me deleting it in certificates. When deleted it appears again when I restart Firefox. "Your browser is being managed by your organization".

Note I believe its from threat protection from NordVPN, however, I deleted NordVPN and threat protection and all the remnants with an App Shredder for this to still be here.

I am using Firefox version 109.0.1 and MacOS 13.2 (22D49) (i'm using a m1 macbook air)

I have tried manually deleting it multiple times and using the following terminal command recommended to me from someone on reddit.

(Said terminal code I tried) sudo defaults write /Library/Preferences/org.mozilla.firefox EnterprisePoliciesEnabled -bool FALSE

None of this worked. Hopefully there's a fix.
